notes: Last pre-WWII Ford design. Wider bodies and new front-end styling. Production halted February 1942 for wartime production. Sealed-beam headlights introduced 1940. Flathead engines require period-specific knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford De Luxe article, January 2025 revision.

Postwar continuation of 1942 design with minor updates. Woodie Sportsman convertible featured wood body panels. First full production year was 1946. Flathead engines require vintage expertise and period-correct parts. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford De Luxe article, January 2025 revision.

First all-new postwar Ford design with modern styling. Independent front suspension. Slab-sided bodies with integrated fenders. Revolutionary design influenced entire industry. Flathead engines require period-specific service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Custom article, January 2025 revision.

First dedicated Ford truck series, replacing car-based pickups. F-1 through F-8 designations for different weight classes. All-new cab design. Flathead engines require vintage truck expertise. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford F-Series article, January 2025 revision.
